CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 25, 1968, pg. 15, reads: "Easter's Signature - Widespread hunt for bat, to spell that of late Josh Gibson, led to the above scene, in 1947, 21 seasons ago, Left to right - watching Like Easter sign $7,500 Grays' contract - are Rufus (Sonnyman) Jackson, president, and Seward (See) Posey, traveling manager of Grays. An unidentified player looks on.  Gibson had drawn $8, 500 in 1946, the year previous.  In late 1949, Cleveland Indians signed Easter to an $18,000 pact."
TitMainTitle: Rufus "Sonnyman" Jackson seated on left, Seward "See" Posey standing on left, and another man gathered around baseball player Luke Easter signing Homestead Grays contract, in office, another version
